intro: Brachyscome tadgellii, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in coastal areas of South Australia. It has small, lobed leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Brachyscome tadgellii is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often used in native gardens.
